Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery cylindrical vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is partly covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393275) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393275)
